titleStmt.title: The araignement of an vnruly tongue Wherein the faults of an euill tongue are opened, the danger discouered, the remedies prescribed, for the taming of a bad tongue, the right ordering of the tongue, and the pacifying of a troubled minde against the wrongs of an euill tongue. By George Web, preacher of Gods word at Stepleashton in Wiltshire.
titleStmt.author: Webbe, George, 1581-1642.

titleStmt.title: The araignement of an vnruly tongue Wherein the faults of an euill tongue are opened, the danger discouered, the remedies prescribed, for the taming of a bad tongue, the right ordering of the tongue, and the pacifying of a troubled minde against the wrongs of an euill tongue. By George Web, preacher of Gods word at Stepleashton in Wiltshire.
titleStmt.author: Webbe, George, 1581-1642.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G.P[urslowe] for Iohn Budge, and are to bee sold at his shop in Pauls church-yard, at the signe of the greene Dragon,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
